intro: Elodea nuttallii, commonly known as the waterweed, is a submerged aquatic plant native to North America. It is characterized by its long, flexible stems and small, whorled leaves that are typically 2–5 cm in length. This plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Elodea nuttallii plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and oxygen through photosynthesis. It is also used in scientific studies for its ease of cultivation and rapid growth rate.
